title: bash.exe always "disables" Insert Mode; incorrect cursor movement
body: Any invocation of bash.exe disables Insert Mode, even if it's already enabled on the current window.  cmd.exe offers the ability to persistently apply options to a shortcut, but even this doesn't work; Insert Mode will be disabled.  This means that in order to get correct cursor movement, I need to manually enable Insert Mode each time I launch bash.exe.  Otherwise, the text that I see in the terminal doesn't necessarily align with what I'm actually typing.
